channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-56] Unnecessary HQLClient Object creation in a shell loop.
item.description:
Shell.java

while(....) {
  HQLClient hql = new HQLClient(...);
}
item.summary: Unnecessary HQLClient Object creation in a shell loop.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Uploaded patch is resolve this problem.
Submitting.
It's a unnecessary object creation.
Edward: What is the problem here? Can you help me out? I've looked at the patch and at the description above and am having trouble figuring the problem you are trying to solve. Thanks.

BEFORE: 



while(....) {

  HQLClient hql = new HQLClient(...);

  hql.executeQuery(queryString);

}



AFTER:



HQLClient hql = new HQLClient(...);

while(....) {

  hql.executeQuery(queryString);

}

BEFORE involves the creation of hqlclient object per iteration.
AFTER avoids hqlclient object creation in the loop.

It's too trivial change, but i prefer short-term patch because i need a confirm.
If it is not good work model, please let me know.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12373469/2653.patch
against trunk revision r613115.

@author +1. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

javadoc +1. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

javac +1. The applied patch does not generate any new compiler warnings.

findbugs +1. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs warnings.

core tests -1. The patch failed core unit tests.

contrib tests +1. The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: http://lucene.zones.apache.org:8080/hudson/job/Hadoop-Patch/1641/testReport/
Findbugs warnings: http://lucene.zones.apache.org:8080/hudson/job/Hadoop-Patch/1641/artifact/trunk/build/test/findbugs/newPatchFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle results: http://lucene.zones.apache.org:8080/hudson/job/Hadoop-Patch/1641/artifact/trunk/build/test/checkstyle-errors.html
Console output: http://lucene.zones.apache.org:8080/hudson/job/Hadoop-Patch/1641/console

This message is automatically generated.
unrelatated error. Please commit it, boss.

Thanks for adding a description (Considered description make the life of a reviewer easier). IIUC, this patch is 'optimizing' shell.

If so, this issue is trivial – I set it so – and we all should be working on more important issues.

What does the below test?


+  public void test() {

+    HQLClient hql = new HQLClient(new HBaseConfiguration());

+    ReturnMsg rm = hql.executeQuery("non-command;");

+    assertTrue(rm.getType() == -9);

+  }

Should be a javadoc. or comment because I cannot from reading the code figure what it does or what the -9 expected result means (These -9s are in a few places. They should be defines if all the -9s mean the same thing).

Why the HQLClient constructor change using setters instead of passing params to the Constructor? It seemed better the way it was previous.

Is the offset of 9 safe in the below?


+    conf.set("hbase.master", masterAddress.substring(9, masterAddress.length()));

If so, should be accompanied by a coment saying why (Why can't passed masterAddress by null or not match the expected pattern)?
• substring(9, masterAddress.length()) will be improved.
submitting.
re-scheduling

please commit it.
Edward - we can't commit this now because it is a trivial change and we are in 0.16 feature freeze. This will get into 0.17 as soon as we are branched.
submitting to a new TRUNK

Applied v4. Thanks for the patch Edward.

FYI, before committing I changed the version to align w/ hbase version rather than run a separate hql version number. You might also consider removing the 'udanax' from the header message since no one else has their name in code.
